page.title: 10Gaddesden Row: Flora & Fauna
page.content: It is thought that there are about 13 {fallow deer}on the Halsey estate and also some{barking deer.}They are very small. They are protected on the farm. A deer has been seen near Ledgemore Lane. Watkins Pightle,the field behind the school, is full of rabbits. Moles too! Our Headmaster saw a fox when he was giving out leaflets for the car boot sale. There are many pheasants too. One of the parents raises pheasants. Mr.Halsey is going to as well. Birds nest all round the school buildings. A swallow is nesting over the canteen door. Grey squirrels are common too. Mr.Badcock grows nettles for the{wall brown butterfly.}There are bluebells down School Lane, and there are old meadows nearby with{rare {orchids.}We haven't seen a badger but we know they are around. There are lots of thick woods.
